Mark Baker wrote:
>> Another alternative would be to use a subordinate URI
>> (e.g. POST  <http://example.org/foo/bar> http://example.org/foo/bar does
the equivalent of PUT to
>>  <http://example.org/foo> http://example.org/foo), but that screw up
caches.
 
Why does that screw up caches?  I thought only GET was cachable?

-Mike Schinkel 
http://www.mikeschinkel.com/blogs/ 
http://www.welldesignedurls.org/
